website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for carrying a light, compact camera.
pros: The Case Logic includes a slide mechanism that makes it easy to grab your camera to shoot
Attaching a camera is a matter of screwing the strap onto the bottom
Very handy for physical excursions like hiking, or otherwise being out and about
cons: Has to be attached using the tripod slot in the camera, so it's not possible to use the strap and tripod concurrently

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for a 70-200mm f/2.8
customer_reviews.text: I use this strap for the 70-200mm f/2.8 lens and dslr body combo. It is sturdy enough for the job and keeps my hands free for portrait directing. The shoulder pad likes to move around during operation. I find myself having to constantly adjust the pad back to the top of my shoulder. The screw for the mount looks very sturdy and performs well. If you are not familiar with a 70-200mm f 2.8 lens, it weighs a few pounds and is made of mostly metal. The screw and plastic bolt combination does a nice job attached to the tripod collar of the lens. Overall I recommend the strap for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT not exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I have other sling camera straps but they are cumbersome and not very easy to use or comfortable This one is great BUT I do have one concern. The fastener to the bottom of the camera is made of plastic and I'm a little uneasy about using for my pro level cameras. I would much prefer a metal connector.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W / Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera sling
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera sling. I was looking for something better than the strap that came with my camera because it's really uncomfortable and the material used for the strap is not great quality. I also wanted a sling that can be screwed into the tripod mount of the bottom of the camera. This was the best strap for the price! The clips for the straps are sturdy compared to the ones that came with the camera - a big plus! The strap doesn't bother me much, even after a few hours of carrying it on my shoulder. I love the idea of such easy access for the camera. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Excelent product!
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my last trip, was carrying a Eos Rebel with a 18-135, the strap made it very confortable to move around, and it’s great to have both hands free and not to worry about the strap sliding down your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of the weight off your neck
customer_reviews.text: I really that this sling can take a lot of the weight from your neck. I use the 1dx mii and that is a heavy camera to have in your hand let alone around your neck. This sling is strong and it takes a lot of the weight from your neck. The bolt that goes on the bottom of the camera is very durable and strong as well. its a good length as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Better than your camera neck strap but...
customer_reviews.text: ...not made for a woman's body. The padding is just WAY too thick and wide for narrow shoulders and if your camera isnt heavy enough, it sits awkwardly across the chest. Not the fault of the manufacture, just the nature of things. If you are a petite woman with above an average sized chest area, I suggestwhich I am waiting for in the mail as I type this. Other than that small but important gripe, this camera sling is an inexpensive and more comfortable upgrade from the neck strap that came in the box with your DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Shanda Renee

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: After searching for the right strap I came accross this and read the great reviews and decided to try it as the cost is great too. It is awseome! I no longer have the neck/shoulder pain like with my old strap (the original strap that came with my Nikon DSLR), I can wear this all day and feel comfortable. When I put it on I always take 2 seconds to check that it's tightly secured and it always is. I very rarely use a tripod but if I used one a lot this may be annoying having to unscrew every time. Camera easily slides up and down the strap. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: JNB

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price not the best strap in the world.
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay. There’s definitely straps out there you can pay more for that I’m sure are better. The shoulder padding slides a lot and it’s almost stays where you need it or want it but it gets the job done holding my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tustin

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: Shoulder pad does not stay in place, I'm constantly adjusting it. Sliding function kind of useless as the strap just slides around my shoulder with it. Kind of a pain because it attaches to the bottom, you have to remove the strap when you want to use a tripod or stow it in a bag (or at least my bag, you do). Otherwise it works. I always use it on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I now own, and use two of these straps. Keep the camera at the ready, by my side. No stress on the neck (I keep it over one shoulder and my neck, with the strap across my chest). Only drawback; the camera doesn't sit upright because of the connectors on the bottom (plastic loop that screws into the bottom of the camera and hold the strape.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoulder strap. It’s so comfortable and it makes the camera feel light and it’s out of the way in front of you from getting it banged up and on your side or even towards your back side.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze

customer_reviews.title: I went to ebay and found a much better piece to screw into the tripod mount
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and Immediately had to make a change. The piece that screws into the tripod mount keeps backing out. The camera has disconnected twice. Luckily I caught it before it hit the ground both times. I went to ebay and found a much better piece to screw into the tripod mount. This new piece was all of 3 bucks and is really small. Now no disasters. The strap is long and comfortable. No complaints about the strap. That bottom tripod mount piece means losing a star, it's bulky and unreliable. But....you get what you pay for;-)
customer_reviews.author: No BS please!

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: the strap is nice and well made, although when in use it will tend to move on your shoulder. i wish the pad was grippier to end the constant readjustments. --Update: I now have 4 of these straps and some of the C-clips has either broken off or unscrewed itself from the 1/4 threaded insert. Now there is nothing to keep the locking knob from falling completely off. I do notice they upgraded the C-clips to larger ones from tiny little ones in a couple of straps but this design is inherently flawed.
customer_reviews.author: silverboi

customer_reviews.title: I'd love it if the little connector piece was metal for ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd love it if the little connector piece was metal for extra strength, but it's held up and seems really super durable so far so no real issue there. Comfortable to wear, anyone not using a quick sling of some kind at this point just seems silly to me. It'll totally change your shooting habits if you're using to the standard neck strap.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Novel and effective way of carrying a small camera
customer_reviews.text: I use this to carry my Olympus Tough series waterproof camera with my while motorcycle riding. It allows me to take occasional one-handed shots and then quickly release the camera safely. I don't know if I would like it with a full-sized DSLR but with a compact point-and-shoot I've found it very handy. I was encouraged to try it because of my positive impression of Case Logic's quality and the low price. Very please for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Particular

customer_reviews.title: Great product but strap length a little too short for tall folks.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product - prefer it greatly over standard over-the-neck camera strap that came with my Nikon 5100. The only drawback - and it is significant enough for me to ding one star - is that even fully extended the strap is too short for a 6 foot tall man with medium build. One or two more inches of strap length would earn it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dave J.

customer_reviews.title: Was great, then came unscrewed
customer_reviews.text: I used this for awhile and really liked it. Then, recently, the screw came undone from the tripod mount and my camera fell onto pavement, breaking a lens and damaging the body. My fault for not checking it before each use? Can't recommend. Ruined a very expensive lens.
customer_reviews.author: bmorejojo

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Feels very sturdy and secure especially great for those long days as it sits comfortable over the shoulder. My wife loves it because now she doesn't have to hurt her neck with the factory straps. The only thing i wish was that you could remove the pad by sliding it off the strap but it is sewn in. Most of the time I have a 50mm prime lens on my camera so its very lightweight and this big cushy pad can be a bit too much. For the quality/price this product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great, Comfortable Strap
customer_reviews.text: This strap is absolutely wonderful, and great for if you have two cameras crossing over each other. My only gripe is that you can't set it down on a table, which is a small issue, but also, you have to keep checking that it's tightened, because the screw loosens over time. It's a very expensive piece of equipment to be gambling with if the screw comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: GREAT sling for your camera I highly reccommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this sling has changed how I carry a camera. I used to hate to carry my camera and then would leave it at home never using it. This easy on adapter for the sling allows me to comfortably carry my camera any where. I was just at the Indianapolis Speedway for work and this sling saved my life it was so easy and allowed such quick access to my camera I just cannot say enough about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Lover

customer_reviews.title: I knew we were gonna do a lot of walking and I hate having my camera bounce in front of me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on my sons 3 day field trip to the outer banks. I knew we were gonna do a lot of walking and I hate having my camera bounce in front of me. the strap fits wonderfully and is comfortable, I wore it all day long. It was easy to grab my camera and pull it up when I wanted to take a picture, but was out of the way when I didn't need it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Proven

customer_reviews.title: Nice but has design issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice strap that hold camera at the ready with a few minor issues. First issue: The attachment to the tripod thread is very large. This makes holding the camera with attached battery grip (D610) impossible as the mount fills my hand. Next issue is that the shoulder pad while padded is not sticky. Thus during use it drifts around and off of the shoulder so that the benefit of the padding is lost
customer_reviews.author: Roger the Consultant

customer_reviews.title: I really love this over the traditional strap
customer_reviews.text: I really love this over the traditional strap. It relieves so much pressure from my neck! My only complaint is that the cushion doesn't adjust it's position at all. Sometimes I wish I could move it.
customer_reviews.author: MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: strong and functional.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose if I had more than $800 worth of gear at the end I would opt for something more expensive but I don't. I have full confidence dropping my T2i with a 55-250 down the length of the sling. There is one downside which is a quick release tripod mounting plate cannot be mounted with this. However this was completely inline with the description.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Bad screw design
customer_reviews.text: The sling itself is decent enough, good build quality and relatively comfortable to wear, the problem comes when I want to put the camera away into my holster bag, I need to unscrew the strap first since the screw on the strap stands out so much and can't be manipulated in any direction. Other than that it's good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: johan van dyk

customer_reviews.title: Great strap.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I would like it but decided to get one anyway since I wasn't too happy with the standard strap included with my camera. I replaced my strap with this and this one actually gave me easier control of the camera and have easier to access and set aside as needed. I like that the strap slides smoothly from the mount point. I think I will get another one for my other camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great handsfree sling
customer_reviews.text: I've used this sling for a couple of months now, and find it works very well with my Nikon. I have to use trekking poles for balance when I walk, and this sling keeps my camera safely out of the way, but ready at a moment's notice when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Kille

customer_reviews.title: Great strap
customer_reviews.text: This strap is great to wear cross-body and be able to grab your camera quickly to take a shot. Its easier on my body than a neck-strap and enables me to multi-task with my children while I push the camera to my back. It is quick to take apart and place the camera on a tripod too. I have enjoyed having this strap.
customer_reviews.author: Dpinklet

customer_reviews.title: Best product for every photographer
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate thing every photographer needs and it makes your life so much easier to not have to hold the camera the entire day. So very comfortable to wear into use at all times.
customer_reviews.author: roamieboy

customer_reviews.title: Good product does the job
customer_reviews.text: Really solved the problem for me. I was never comfortable wearing the camera around my neck or hanging from the shoulder. After not much time I would begin to get pain in both areas. This product allows the camera to be where you want it, usually at my side, without feeling the weight or burden. The camera is instantly at the ready when you want to take a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fully Recommended! Worths the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Case Logic quick sling. For the half of the price I can have the same features as with the Rapid Sling and can spend that money on something more useful. It's lightweight and it's solid. I have a Nikon D3200 and it will hold it perfectly and I am confident it won't break apart I recommend you to keep it as tight as possible because if it's too loose the camera bounces a bit possibly damaging the lens
customer_reviews.author: Georgina S.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This strap works very nicely for hiking and keeping camera ready without bouncing on your chest. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mjg

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Sturdy and well made. I'm glad I purchased it because my camera strap that came with my camera was too short and uncomfortable. This is so nice. The shoulder pad is a little wide, but it wouldn't stop me from buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The DCS-101 sling takes the weight off my neck and puts most of the weight on my shoulder. A relief for my neck. It even works well when I sit down to eat; I was usually looking for a place to put my camera when I sat down to eat. Sometimes, I don't feel it at all. The shoulder pad does move around, but it's easy to just slide it back (easy to slide off and easy to slide back on). The knob used to connect to the camera can be locked using a separate knob; I tightened both and haven't had any loosening problem yet after 4 all day outings.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Tak

customer_reviews.title: The plastic connection felt like it could break so I wasn't going to risk ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a washer break while I was installing it. I returned it and bought the Black Rapid. The plastic connection felt like it could break so I wasn't going to risk it and spent more money for the Black Rapid.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight on the bottom of the camera. No worrys about the camera breaking off.
customer_reviews.text: Fits tight on the bottom of the camera. No worrys about the camera breaking off.
customer_reviews.author: Sammichman

customer_reviews.title: Works great especially with my telephoto lens on
customer_reviews.text: Works great especially with my telephoto lens on, camera hangs down so telephoto lens isn't sticking straight out and with regular lens on the camera hangs in a contortable position, easy to get to camera, just a bit of hassle to get off to use tripod, otherwise I love it and recommend it other people
customer_reviews.author: Ronald H Hays

customer_reviews.title: Good except for the strap.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this during my trial tests at home, but when I took it ouside.. the shoulder rest continues to slide off my shoulder. That defeats the purpose of a shoulder strap. Aside from that, I enjoy using it as it is much more convenient than your traditional neck strap.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.  Glad to have found this!
customer_reviews.text: Was missing out on this for a long time. This shames the strap that cameras come with. This puts the camera in a comfortable spot for casual travel, and makes it very accessible. Also nice when calling for rain, this tucks nicely under the jacket on either your left or right side. Hard to find a better value for sure.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera sling! This sling is great value and does the job. The padded sling is sturdy and will last.
customer_reviews.author: Tania G. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not the one for my camera.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this might work for my new Canon M camera as I don't like the small OEM strap but while it is a good product the shoulder pad was too large for my shoulder and I didn't like the camera being upside down as I felt it could damage the top too easily. Might be a good one for other cameras and shoulders though.
customer_reviews.author: ChrispyCreamy

customer_reviews.title: I love the way this strap works.
customer_reviews.text: I love the function of this type of strap. Works across the chest and the camera actually hangs upside down. You grab it and bring it up to eye level without removing the strap from your shoulder/body. This won't slide off your shoulder or hang around your neck and bounce against your chest.
customer_reviews.author: MFormby

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit shorter than I expected but other than that I'm happy with it. The material the strap is made from is a slick webbing type and looks and feels very strong. You could also use this as a neck strap if you wanted. It's definitely more comfortable than the ones I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic D ring will break be careful.
customer_reviews.text: Strap worked as advertised and was comfortable but failed in less than 2 months. I had it on my Canon 6D and was walking to my shoot when the PLASTIC D ring failed and dumped my $3500 camera and lens on the ground. May be useful for light cameras???, but I would not trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works just as it should
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent little strap. I have it the camera I keep in my vehicle and it is great for quick grabbing and going. Camera stays out of the way when not in use. If I didn't use a tripod with my other camera I would get one for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: These slings work great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these camera slings. I have one on all three of my camera bodies and work great!! I’d recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Alan Daughtrey

customer_reviews.title: finally.....a smart camera accessories
customer_reviews.text: fairly priced, great asset... no more dangle ropes from the neck staps
customer_reviews.author: Elaine K.

customer_reviews.title: Securely stays in the tripod mounting hole, the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Securely stays in the tripod mounting hole, the plastic loop looks somewhat fragile so I generally support the camera with a free hand anyhow. The shoulder pad does tend to move off the shoulder and needs to be repositioned occasionally. For the price and general features however, this does serve its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Golferguy

customer_reviews.title: Good alternate to the OEM strap
customer_reviews.text: I always found the OEM strap puts a lot of stress on my neck. The OEM strap also makes the cross-body carrying out of balance. Overall the DCS101 strap is well-built with good padding. It takes a few minutes to get used to having the camera on your side or behind your back. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: PDot4

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: This one is kinda cheaply built. I own another one similar to this and thought that I was buying another of the same one, but it wasn't. Keep shopping. This isn't the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Life

customer_reviews.title: You have quick access so you'll never miss those great shots. I am very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the camera strap that came with the camera. This strap, with the padded shoulder, makes carrying the camera a pleasure. You have quick access so you'll never miss those great shots. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Olsen

customer_reviews.title: No neck strain!  Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a three week trip to Africa on Safari. Kept my camera secure and by my side. No neck strain! Use to bring camera up for a quick shot.
customer_reviews.author: Temecula Foodie

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Strap
customer_reviews.text: Having a small child and needing to capture memories and wanted to have a strap that would allow me have a camera on me and allow to move freely. I love this strap, it secures the camera and i don't have to be concerned with bending over or moving around with this sling strap.
customer_reviews.author: North Ga Lover

customer_reviews.title: Vertical positition difficulties
customer_reviews.text: Not good for vertical shooting. the strap connects to a huge D ring that juts out from the bottom preventing the user from shooting and holding the camera vertically.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Showery

customer_reviews.title: I adjusted to where I like it. Its a nice addition to my
customer_reviews.text: A friend helped me with this. I adjusted to where I like it. Its a nice addition to my collection
customer_reviews.author: Brian Berlin

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this little gem. It saved my neck from those long days of shooting out in remote locations that you need to hike on. I really can't imagine ever using my nikon strap again. For the price you can't beat it. I even use it with my battery grip.
customer_reviews.author: Sev

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when I am constantly shooting and dont want to be bothered continually placing my camera in a bag. Strap goes across your chest and trust, theres plenty of slack if needed. The part that attaches to bottom of camera is a good quality and will support the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sir_King

customer_reviews.title: Great for cycling with my camera.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for bike riding. I want my camera to be ready to use but yet close to my body, and this works great. I do check, and occasionally tighten, the bolt that fastens it to the camera.
customer_reviews.author: dinjohn1

customer_reviews.title: I would pass on this one due to design (build quality is very sturdy and good though)
customer_reviews.text: The way the rather large thumb screw sticks out makes it a pain to set down (without it resiting on the lens) or to put it in a case.... I would pass on this one due to design (build quality is very sturdy and good though)
customer_reviews.author: Mr&Mrs.K

customer_reviews.title: Great Sling for your camera!
customer_reviews.text: This makes carrying my big Canon DLSR a breeze and very easy to swing up into position for that great shot. The price for the quality of components is amazing. Don't spend any more than this if you are looking for a quality sling for your camera!
customer_reviews.author: K. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: this works just like the black rapid on a Nikon D90
customer_reviews.text: As the owner of a black rapid sport two until it was stolen along with a lot of other camera gear, this works just like the black rapid on a Nikon D90. I have not seen any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Wang

customer_reviews.title: Eh, just pass on it.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in the product because normally Case is decent quality. Feels flimsy and is uncomfortable to wear. Using with a Nikon D5300.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: No more camera neck.
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying the product, well constructed solution for camera neck.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Makes using your camera during a photo shoot so much better. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoJones

customer_reviews.title: strap works very well
customer_reviews.text: This strap worked very well, allowing quick access to the camera. It seemed very secure. The only negative and this is just due to the basic design is that it is difficult to set the camera on a table. It also doesn't fit in the camera bag very well, but I remove it for that. Overall I would recommend this as a buy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Marten

customer_reviews.title: Great! 4 STAR!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Bought a second one for my 2nd camera and now carry both at once. Keeps camera out of the way and to the side. I use it everyday!
customer_reviews.author: adriansmessages

customer_reviews.title: Great for fast action shooting.
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Extremely secure. No chance of coming loose. Does slide on shoulder when you bring up the camera but no big deal. Used for fast action wildlife photography and was very very helpful, and for shooting impromptu modelling in arts/urban/crowd venue.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bookstore

customer_reviews.title: Case Logic DCS-101 Quick Sling
customer_reviews.text: The quick sling performs as advertised. I first used the sling with my Nikon D3200 during the 2 day Carnival celebrations in Trinidad W.I. and it was comfortable to wear all day and securely held the camera. I would recommend to anyone who wants to replace the neck band that comes with their camera.
customer_reviews.author: KronosTT

customer_reviews.title: Great strap, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and comfortable to wear. I wore this every day on my 14 day vacation and never had any problems. I felt comfortable letting my Canon 7D hang by my side while walking around. The way the camera slides up and down the strap makes it super easy to quickly take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: The Pimento

customer_reviews.title: Case Logic DCS-101 DSLR Quick Sling
customer_reviews.text: nice sling strap for your camera to keep at your waist! Secure attachment, comfortable shoulder strap, highly recommended! Case Logic always seems to make great products at good prices! Case Logic has never failed me throughout the years!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Case Logic DCS-101 DSLR Quick Sling - Used with Canon T2i - Recommended !!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product from case logic. No more neck pains in my trips. The build quality is good as expected from Case logic for the money you pay. Using the DSLR with this becomes an ease. You can adjust the length easily. You bring the camera from resting/hanging positions on side to shooting position very quickly and it will not get stuck anywhere. Works Seamless, Would surely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LALATENDU PAHADSINGH

customer_reviews.title: it feels and look sturdy, but the piece that screws into the camera ...
customer_reviews.text: The strap is Ok, it feels and look sturdy, but the piece that screws into the camera is just too big, you can't fit that in the case of your camera. I recommend getting the FotoTech Quick Release snap hook, it's a great complement.
customer_reviews.author: j. Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love it works perfectly, took it to Vegas did not have to work about my neck hurting. I have a nikon d3000 so that thing isn't light. Just slings to my hip and I can slide the camera up the strap in an instant.
customer_reviews.author: Aleea

customer_reviews.title: Excellent strap
customer_reviews.text: I saw someone with a strap similar to this at the zoo, but didn't catch the brand before they walked away. After some research I decided on this one, and I am impressed. The shoulder pad is a little bulky, but it's great if you're carrying your camera around for some time (as I tend to). The camera moves very easily on it, and I'm never worried about it coming undone and falling to the ground when I let it hang just by the strap. Overall I'm happy with my choice!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki D

customer_reviews.title: Great strap, very handy positioning
customer_reviews.text: This strap is excellent. The way it allows you to hang your camera at rest and easily bring it up for shooting is fantastic. Speaking of shooting, anyone who has used a single point rifle sling knows how convenient this system can be, especially when getting quick photos/shots.
customer_reviews.author: LoganWest

customer_reviews.title: no quick release
customer_reviews.text: didn't realize how important a quick release is. if you shoot with two cameras you will wish you spent more on a strap with a quick release
customer_reviews.author: sphen

customer_reviews.title: Light, comfortable sling
customer_reviews.text: This is very light, and the padding is comfortable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: It works good
customer_reviews.text: Works great and shipping was on time. The only thing I would like to see is if the screw part was smaller
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Five star camera strap
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with both the design of this product and the quality of the materials.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet effective
customer_reviews.text: Slings around either shoulder and screws onto the tripod mount on your dslr. Can adjust its length but It's only about 2 feet long so consider where it will be hanging on your body and how comfortable that will be. I worry about the plastic that holds the 1/4" screw to the strap but only time will tell. It would be nice to have a card pocket on the padding. Otherwise solid product, really nice to have on casual shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good for certain situations.
customer_reviews.text: I use this once in a while in certain situations.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the stock camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Great strap. Exactly what I wanted. Great price. I have it adjested to be near my hip and it is very easy to grab the quick shot. Very easy to hold all day. I did notice if your day causes you to be bending down or picking up kids then your camera will fall forward. Not a big deal but just a shock the first time it happened. Just be aware of surroundings...ground, your kids head, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and just as good.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my NEX5. I was initially going to spend $70 on a different brand before I cam across this. Glad I found this from Case Logic.
customer_reviews.author: Tessei Ban

customer_reviews.title: Not happy as you can imagine
customer_reviews.text: The screw kept twisting around every time i walked around and would get loose....my camera fell three times, finally after the scratches from the first two falls....the third fall broke my camera. Not happy as you can imagine. So disappointed in the brand.
customer_reviews.author: H. gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great strap.
customer_reviews.text: Steady, secure, and comfortable. I love how it fits. The only thing that seems to be an issue is that the padded part tends to slide off my shoulder at times. I'm thinking that maybe a line of silicone would keep it there better. Definitely recommend. Great bang for the buck. (I have not owned any other strap so I'm not sure how it compares).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.
customer_reviews.text: This sling works great and has the camera sit around waist level or a little lower. I'm 6'3" and the camera placement works well for me. I do have it adjusted to its longest length however. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Foster

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this anyone with a family. It seems sturdy enough, and unlike the hand-grip which I had previously, it lets me keep both hands free. There are probably better products out there in terms of quality, but for my uses this works well and is less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: JoshT

customer_reviews.title: I just love it. I use it a lot while traveling ...
customer_reviews.text: I just love it. I use it a lot while traveling or playing music on the street, you can walk and your camera wont bump you on your chest, you cam reach it quickly and always in the right position. I recomend a lense hood, because it may hit some wall if you turn fast, nothung dangerous but there is nothing wrong with a bit extra precaution. It goes very tight to your side so you dont have to worry about hitting anything
customer_reviews.author: Ferdy

customer_reviews.title: A great underwater video camera strap!
customer_reviews.text: A great underwater video camera strap! It's lasted well in sea water, with regular fresh water cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Waikiki

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This feels great and looks great, the only thing I dont like is the loop at the camera is plastic. The length is great and im 6'2 and not a thin guy. It sits nicely at my side and does not pounce around when im walking/hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Khellendrose

customer_reviews.title: ... style of strap saves so much time and is super
customer_reviews.text: This style of strap saves so much time and is super convenient
customer_reviews.author: R Descartes

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY SUPERIOR
customer_reviews.text: ...highly superior to standard straps the come with most cameras...easier on the load as well...takes a few walks about to be comfortable with it...VERY WELL MADE...
customer_reviews.author: Outside the Pit

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Used it occasionally for a month or so. The part that attaches to the camera is plastic and broke easily.
customer_reviews.author: mrunn

customer_reviews.title: A great product. Prefer the sling design rather than around ...
customer_reviews.text: A great product. Prefer the sling design rather than around the neck strap. Will definitely keep "camera bumps" down to a minimum, especially when hiking .
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Nishimoto

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, good price
customer_reviews.text: Fits comfortably on the shoulder, much more so than a conventional neck strap. Only gripe is that the padding tends to slip off of the shoulder but that is not a deal breaker. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary London

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure you could buy a more expensive version of this and it would be a bit nicer on the build quality, but for the price it does exactly what it says. Very secure and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Strap for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This product works great with a camera. It is does not stress you neck like some sling do. I am pleased with it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sartain

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Better quality than I was expecting. I rarely use a strap. The only times I do are when I am in a very busy public place mainly because I don't want anyone snatching my camera. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Conyers III

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a sling strap for your DSLR?
customer_reviews.text: Around the neck camera straps attached to a heavy DSLR all day give me backache. After trying several camera sling-straps costing anywhere from $70 on down, I have decided that this is the absolutely most perfect sling. One very simple adjustment, smooth sliding movement for camera. Secure screw-on tripod mount fitting. Long enough to wear at my hip. Nice wide shoulder stay-put pad with light padding. And nicely finished and well-made at a reasonable price! Looking for a sling strap for your DSLR? Go no further. Highly recommend. I also like the Joby-brand sling strap as well.
customer_reviews.author: FogNamedKarl

customer_reviews.title: This one beats that $30 product in quality and sturdy looks.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a similar product in store for $30+. This one beats that $30 product in quality and sturdy looks.
customer_reviews.author: atiwary

product_meta.title: Case Logic DCS-101 DSLR Quick Sling (Black)
product_meta.description: The Quick Sling ensures the shortest time between your camera hanging idle to you shooting a photo. The Quick Sling wears comfortably cross-body and your camera rests lens-down securely at your side. When it’s time to shoot, the camera glides quickly along the strap to ensure you never miss the shot.
feature_bullets: Designed to fit DSLR, compact system, high zoom and point and shoot cameras
Glide hardware screws directly onto the base of your camera via the tripod mount allowing camera to rest securely at your side with lens facing down
Custom, swivel hardware enables camera to move with body while in motion
Camera quickly and easily glides up the strap when you’re ready to take the shot
Padded shoulder strap with breathable air mesh is shaped to conform perfectly around your shoulder for maximum comfort
Adjustable strap provides a custom fit for any size photographer and can be worn on either shoulder

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars746 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
